title: Maintain customizations for UD/UCMDB out-of-the-box resources
content:
Persona Location
Customer admin Source UCMDB

Out-of-the-box (OOTB) resource types of class model - auto merged

The following OOTB resource types of class model are auto merged during the Content Pack upgrade:

  • Configuration Item Types
  • Identification
  • Relationships
  • Calculated Relationships
  • validlinks

No manual maintenance work is required at all.

Maintain customizations for OOTB resource types included in the Content Pack upgrade report

For OOTB discovery resource types covered by the Content Pack upgrade report, you can leverage the upgrade report to compare and maintain the customization data.

Go to <UCMDBServer>\runtime\log\package_reports\customer_1\cpUpgrade\defaultFolder, you should see folders named by the timestamps when you deploy the Content Packs, for example, 2021-12-12_15-16-33-864.

Each of the <Timestamp> folders contains the following:

Item Description
backup.zip

This package contains a backup copy of the following 4 types of resources only: 

  • discoveryConfigFiles
    • EnricherServiceSettings.ini
    • globalSettings.xml
    • globalFiltering.xml
  • discoveryJobs
  • discoveryPatterns
  • discoveryScripts.

The following are the sub-folders in this package:

  • INSTALLED: The out-of-the-box resources from the currently in-use Content Pack.
  • CUSTOMIZED: Your customized resources.
  • NEW: The resources to be deployed from the new Content Pack.
upgrade_report.csv Contains upgrade report details. For details about how to use the upgrade report, see the example below. 

The following is an example of how to leverage the upgrade report to maintain the customization data:

  1. To find out which packages require manual updates to include the customization data, open the upgrade_report.csv file and apply the filter.

    You can filter the packages using the following two columns:

    • Equality Status column: Filter out INSTALLED_NEW_EQUAL and ALL_DIFFERENT.
    • Package column: Filter out a desired package, for example, DDMInfra.zip. This allows you to review all resource files contained in one package. Make sure you review all resources in each and every package.

  2. Compare and find out the differences in each resource file (as listed in the Name column of the upgrade report) to find out the customization data in your system.

    Let's take the globalFiltering.xml file as an example: 

    1. Locate the globalFiltering.xml file from each of the following folders in backup.zip:

      • CUSTOMIZED
      • NEW

    2. Compare and view differences of the globalFiltering.xml file by comparing the file from the CUSTOMIZED and NEW folders using a comparison tool. For example, the following screenshot illustrates customizations made by a customer, and also new settings from the new Content Pack.

  3. Manually merge the customization data.

    In UCMDB Local Client of the source UCMDB, navigate to Data Flow Management > Adapter Management, click Find resource  and locate the globalFiltering.xml file, in the editor pane manually add your customization data and save the file.

    When you're done, the file should contain all data (including customization data) from the CUSTOMIZED and NEW folders of the Content Pack.

  4. Repeat the process of each and every resource file listed in the upgrade report.
